name: T.C.G. Trading Card Gambling
description:
Twenty generative posters about the Pokemon trading card game and booster packs, visualizing the chances of finding rare cards. The goal is creating awareness on the strong parallelism between trading card games and gambling.

The posters are generated through a creative coding script using the OPENRNDR framework framework.

name: EKSIG
description:
Website for the conference Eksig 2023: From Abstractness to Concreteness. Experiential knowledge and the role of prototypes in design research, hosted by the Department of Design of Politecnico di Milano.

An interactive and generative cover has been designed for the website to symbolize the transition from the abstract nature of a concept to the tangible reality of a prototype.

⟶ Browse the website

name: Covid Objects Report
description:
“Covid object” is a label fit to any product in close relation with the pandemic. This research's goal is to find out what these objects are, what was the price fluctuation and how the open-source community reacted when the production chain failed to deliver the needed goods.

The goal of the research is to objectively depict the global approach to “covid objects” to better understand the materiality of covid in this post-pandemic future.

⟶ Consult the report

The analysis of COVID-related items across 17 Amazon marketplaces worldwide has revealed that many of these items serve as souvenirs, encapsulating ideas, trends, and opinions about the pandemic. An online archive has been created to facilitate the exploration of these objects.

⟶ Browse the archive

name: Inquest
description:
Videogames monetization has become more and more predatory over the years, with the exploitation of behavioral psychology to lure people into spending money.

However, the most part of the governments in the world is still reluctant to address these systems as gambling, as well as to take measures against them. Inquest is an independent magazine that analyzes the subtle mechanics developed by the industry, for the purpose of making the consumers aware.

The series is formed by four issues, each one addressing one particular gambling trick used by the industry. Issue 0, the one that was fully designed and printed, focuses on loot boxes.

name: Saiver
role: Brand design, UI and 3D interaction in the website
description:
Saiver is a worldwide-known conditioning systems company. The project consists in the complete renewal of their visual identity and in the realization of a new website, from concept to coding.

The identity system reflects the double nature of the company, on one side extremely technical while on the other side dynamic and light. To reinforce brand communication, the website incorporates a 3D interactive feature that enables users to navigate through an air handling unit, a key product in the company's top-selling lineup.

⟶ Browse the website

name: VCAT
description:
VCAT, short for Visual Content Assessment Tool, is an interactive dashboard specifically crafted to monitor images within Wikipedia's thematic niches. It helps contributors in addressing gaps in visual content through data visualisation.

Complementing the dashboard, an extraction tool has been designed and developed to empower users to extract up-to-date data about articles of their interest.

This initiative stems from insights collected during the original research of my master thesis on user collaboration practices related to images on Wikipedia.

⟶ Explore the dashboard
